elements.2211.03125_e7b472aacac3d03ebdb5137188a01: The GDP growth of national economies is modelled by the logistic function
elements.2211.03125_5f5e714f0e72eb45621718e027a71: Applying it on the GDP data of the World Bank till the year 2020, we forecast the outcome of the competitive GDP growth of Japan, Germany, UK and India, all of whose current GDPs are very close to one another
elements.2211.03125_978152b2a631ce542b94993545a0a: Fulfilling one of the predictions, in 2022 the GDP of India has indeed overtaken the GDP of UK
elements.2211.03125_1ee5c68a4e586d04f16b1d294fb1e: Our overall forecast is that by 2047, the GDP of India will be greater than that of the other three countries
elements.2211.03125_7d9b019df8b1b5d349cc60691d109: We argue that when trade saturates, large and populous countries (like India) have the benefit of high domestic consumption to propel their GDP growth.
elements.2211.03125_7d131c9abbf259ce9079c072efe83: The logistic equation is a standard example of a first-order autonomous nonlinear dynamical system
elements.2211.03125_1394f398452dce3a234dad5a838c0: Introduced originally to study population dynamics
elements.2211.03125_bf2eebe54b9a7efe8e184c5fd1f26: , it was later applied to multiple problems of socio-economic
elements.2211.03125_f28973948ca67253a566f5ae4c9dd: This is because the growth of many natural systems is modelled quite accurately by the logistic equation, the growth of species being one of many such examples
elements.2211.03125_29829ebab0d3a9c785b420fa35546: Hence, the logistic equation is organically compatible with natural evolution in a free and productive environment
elements.2211.03125_9e1408cebf4b6648359838ac6c99b: This principle can be extended to the evolution of economic systems as well, a point of view that is supported by the generally successful logistic modelling of the GDP and trade dynamics of some leading national economies
elements.2211.03125_fe115119e4855bbadd8733b8b1090: The GDP (an abbreviation of Gross Domestic Product) of a country is the market value of goods and services produced by the country in a year
elements.2211.03125_a72ee02b85ff8f28c358d167764a5: GDP thus quantifies the aggregate outcome of the economic activities of a country that are performed all round the year
elements.2211.03125_f0135fbcfb02d797aabae24c7daa0: As such, the GDP of a national economy is a dynamic quantity and its evolution (commonly implying growth) can be followed through time.
elements.2211.03125_0127d9ad85a9ac1dab135a0c69fa8: To this very end, the logistic equation turns out to be a simple and convenient mathematical tool, as has been shown in an earlier study carried out on countries that are ranked high globally in terms of their national GDPs
elements.2211.03125_10621b73770f734f26f64ed0be88a: From a macroeconomic perspective, GDP is a standard yardstick with which the state of a national economy is gauged, and in a global comparison of national economies, the GDP of a country is a reliable point of reference
elements.2211.03125_4b8096ad77e2a59d51952130de012: By this criterion, globally the top six economies pertain to USA, China, Japan, Germany, UK and India
elements.2211.03125_4484bc721764ce079be8096cef2a3: these six countries account for nearly 60
elements.2211.03125_4518b18d733be5dc2a906135086a3: of the global GDP and nearly 40
elements.2211.03125_25637f92d27cfdf58c29fd3667968: China, India and USA are the three most populous countries in the world, accounting for almost 40
elements.2211.03125_1b291cac53c5daffe297e3cfe664f: On the scale of strategic economic regions, the three most dominant economies in the North-Atlantic region are USA, Germany and UK
elements.2211.03125_427e1fc613dedcafedc0c17c3fa7e: Likewise, the three most dominant economies in the Indo-Pacific region are China, Japan and India
elements.2211.03125_22d7b39d24c94ec963a1da1274eaa: All six countries are members of important economic blocs like G7 and BRICS
elements.2211.03125_ffe17010d0a32c13f188dd8afab68: USA, Japan, Germany and UK belong to the former bloc, while China and India belong to the latter
elements.2211.03125_e935f4f62c79488cee6b3f271bd94: Besides, all of these countries are the leading global representatives of three types of economic systems, namely, free economies (USA, Japan, Germany and UK), controlled economies (China) and mixed economies (India)
elements.2211.03125_3457a44d2c8e3b7e23169db8e8038: That only six countries should exert such an overarching influence on the global economy is compatible with the scale-free (power law) degree distribution of GDP
elements.2211.03125_1cd24a75de3fdcbe1244107e86311: because in scale-free distributions the disproportionate dominance of a few elements is a natural occurrence
elements.2211.03125_b992f122e5a6686117642fce7914c: To this the global economic order can be no exception
elements.2211.03125_dcc6d9cc7f532d1d272ed2cad5ca1: Summing up these facts, we can now argue that our study on a restricted scale of six countries (which are global leaders in terms of their GDPs) adequately represents the essence of the GDP growth of more countries that can be studied on a larger scale.
elements.2211.03125_bb235ab7b9bdc5b6c64506d8d544d: Country-wise annual GDP data, on which we have based our modelling and analysis, have been collected from the World Bank website
elements.2211.03125_cf057c38881e9658fb2dca5e9ae88: The basic mathematical theory of the logistic equation and its application on the GDP data are laid out in Sec.
elements.2211.03125_05d2d31737f6ac9fae15dc1fcce25: The numerical and statistical analyses of the modelling are summarized in Table

elements.2211.03125_6eb29a3cd3f7923cd908222a99885: ) beyond 2020, we predict the specific years in which the GDP of one country will overtake the GDP of another
elements.2211.03125_d3885ca83aee15d4ec43ccdc3641a: Three such overtakes are to occur in the future, one of which has already happened in 2022, in precise agreement with our forecast
elements.2211.03125_717de848d8228d317e65593543d33: we remark on the impact of current geopolitics and adverse climatic events on GDP competitiveness.

elements.2211.03125_1da9f29d909fd876d7b594cf1dc3c:
\begin{figure}[]
\begin{center}
\includegraphics[scale=0.65, angle=0]{fig2_jpin.eps}
\caption{\label{f2}\small{
Comparing the GDP growth of Japan and India, which, after China, 
are, respectively,
the countries with the second and the third highest GDPs in the
Indo-Pacific region.
The World Bank data of the annual GDPs of both 
countries start from 1960 ($t=0$)~\citep{jpgd,ingd}. 
The GDP data end in the year 2019 for 
Japan, and the year 2020 for India. The GDP growth of Japan has
a steep gradient in the early years, but by the year 2000, the 
growth has visibly stagnated. Both of these features are 
modelled closely by the logistic function --- the smooth dotted curve.  
In contrast, the GDP growth of India has been slow but on the 
whole steady, and by the year 2020, the GDP of 
India grows with a higher gradient than the GDP of Japan. At
this rate, the GDP of India will eventually 
overtake the GDP of Japan. This forecast is theoretically modelled 
in Fig.~\ref{f4} by extrapolating the  
logistic curves of Japan and India beyond 2020. 
These two theoretical logistic curves model the GDP growth of both 
countries
according to Eq.~(\ref{sologis}), with the values of $\gamma$ and
$k$ in Table~\ref{t1}. 
}}
\end{center}
\end{figure}
elements.2211.03125_800a675359461e39066007edb9d0c:
\begin{figure}[]
\begin{center}
\includegraphics[scale=0.65, angle=0]{fig3_deuk.eps}
\caption{\label{f3}\small{
Comparing the GDP growth of Germany and UK, which, after USA, are, 
respectively,
the countries with the second and the third highest GDPs in the 
North-Atlantic region. 
The World Bank data of the annual GDP of UK start from 
1960 ($t=0$) and end at 2020~\citep{ukgd}. For Germany, however, the 
GDP data~\citep{degd} start from 
1970 ($t =10\,\mathrm{years}$)~\citep{degd}. 
Till 1999-2000, both countries  
ran each other very close in terms of their GDP growth. Thereafter, 
the GDP of Germany has continuously led the GDP of UK. The 
beginning of the lead for Germany is theoretically
captured by the intersection of the smooth dotted curves 
around the year 2000 (shown clearly in Fig.~\ref{f4}). 
These two theoretical logistic curves model the GDP growth of 
both countries
according to Eq.~(\ref{sologis}), with the values of $\gamma$ and
$k$ in Table~\ref{t1}. In the case of Germany the 
theoretical logistic curve has been extrapolated backward before 1970. 
}}
\end{center}
\end{figure}
elements.2211.03125_5492da46accb9073100d66c0de04a: From the GDP values in Figs.
elements.2211.03125_893801b110757f29151ac83ca0297: we realize that USA and China are at present the top two national economies of the world, both with an emphatic lead over the other four countries
elements.2211.03125_5fd3a1a53e195cbc4e646ca84a55f: Although it is unlikely that in the near future the GDP of Japan, Germany, UK or India may surpass the GDP of either USA or China, between USA and China themselves, the GDP gap is reducing progressively, as Fig.
elements.2211.03125_554ad52ab95eb263d1b1e7eb9f1cf: At this rate the GDP of China may surpass the GDP of USA
elements.2211.03125_95409d7f7d10f19310a20b6c53007: The year of this overtake can be identified as the year when the extrapolated logistic function of the China GDP crosses the extrapolated logistic function of the USA GDP
elements.2211.03125_97d3c6264adf8137a683440d8f8a7: However, while the GDP growth of USA is modelled accurately by the logistic function (a claim supported by the clean fit of the upper plot in Fig.
elements.2211.03125_99cfdd6fce7b662958671c61138f0: ), the same observation does not apply to China
elements.2211.03125_9998e1edb4792fa677240d767fffe: The inadequacy of the logistic function to model the GDP growth of China is evident from the lack of closeness between the logistic function and the erratic GDP data in the lower plot in Fig.
elements.2211.03125_e6cac566850c1bb2d17ea61c525e5: , as well as from the high values of
elements.2211.03125_87a8f9d10773ca7c64a3f3d214d05: That the logistic function falls short in modelling the GDP growth of China is known
elements.2211.03125_4e0f785490b59dcc5b04c6df42823: It has been argued that the logistic function properly models the GDP growth of countries that foster a democratic polity, are free of military conflicts on their borders, and promote free economic growth without excessive interference from the state
elements.2211.03125_113db32e7518a2063e8643963a6de: The cumulative effect of these conditions is conducive to a natural development of material well-being
elements.2211.03125_6247430c5743eeee245897ad7c94d: The absence of any one of the aforementioned conditions causes imbalance, as happens in the case of China
elements.2211.03125_271d126d467e8706167f589903af2: On the other hand, in the other five countries, all of the three foregoing conditions prevail in varying degrees, and as such, the logistic equation becomes effective in modelling the GDP growth of these countries
elements.2211.03125_2c92c47640d4096e4286a77827344: This argument is substantiated by all the related plots in Figs.
elements.2211.03125_b7ade30bc882825447047d0372fef: , along with the corresponding values of
elements.2211.03125_860b3480c9b20d8990b0bc576d416: Considering that China is an anomalous case in modelling the dynamics of GDP with the logistic equation, we make no further attempt to compare the logistic growth of the GDPs of USA and China for predicting the year in which the GDP of the latter will overtake the GDP of the former
elements.2211.03125_68c94bf8f671b08271442ba18f0ce: Instead we study the competitiveness of the GDPs of the other five countries
elements.2211.03125_f184278ff621ee928b1cb23c68ebc: However, the GDP of USA is so far ahead of the others that in the foreseeable future none of the GDPs of Japan, Germany, UK and India is likely to grow close enough to the GDP of USA
elements.2211.03125_cdea05436d12e555ecb8fcfea4c6e: In that case, a study of the competitiveness of GDP growth is meaningful only among Japan, Germany, UK and India
elements.2211.03125_11c6ff371cc9601d9843fd7a255fc: Accordingly, it is for these four countries that we forecast the outcome of competitive GDP growth
elements.2211.03125_2668fae899b2cf775f5dd374fa8d0: Our method consists of extrapolating the theoretical logistic functions of Japan, Germany, UK and India beyond the year 2020 in a single graph, and noting the crossing points among the function curves
elements.2211.03125_294d38ea84e487a3d4980b90b9d4d: At the crossing points the GDP of one country overtakes the GDP of another
elements.2211.03125_5f3beb8514d794ed96f519ec7fad9: Since the four logistic functions have been calibrated with the GDP data available up to 2020
elements.2211.03125_a9bfeebb51f3afce12ae0ad61518f: , any crossing beyond this year enables us to forecast future GDP competitiveness among the four countries
elements.2211.03125_b3270953c3279541fe56d5ceb853a: The result of this whole exercise is to be seen in Fig.
elements.2211.03125_adf775245a188403cc82a6a15883e: Of these, two occur in the years 1966 and 2000, in both of which the GDP of UK was successively overtaken by the GDPs of Japan and Germany
elements.2211.03125_654321ff56f1f96d35f06b2267b33: do agree with these intersections, and thus confirm the fundamental soundness of the logistic modelling of GDP growth
elements.2211.03125_7416646c658b9d81f715cf1f8f2aa: While the crossings of 1966 and 2000 occur within the range of the available GDP data, i.e. till the year 2020, there are three more crossing points beyond 2020
elements.2211.03125_7cda11a7f618d2d58a4b2e1230f2a: These are in the years 2022, 2035 and 2047, in all of which, the GDP of India is predicted to successively overtake the GDPs of UK, Germany and Japan.
elements.2211.03125_46702ff75a463d16a75ec84a60984: As it happens, fulfilling the first prediction precisely, in the year 2022 the GDP of India has indeed overtaken the GDP of UK.
elements.2211.03125_8cae03198137168f8bba3342eb74f: This certainly inspires confidence in the predictive power of the logistic modelling of GDP growth.
elements.2211.03125_4b877eedf3016821487a731f14db7:
\begin{figure}[]
\begin{center}
\includegraphics[scale=0.65, angle=0]{fig4_cros.eps}
\caption{\label{f4}\small{
Forecasting the long term outcome of the GDP competitiveness among
Japan, Germany, UK and India. The four theoretical logistic functions,
pertaining to the aforementioned four countries, are calibrated with
the annual GDP data of the World Bank
till 2020~\citep{jpgd,degd,ukgd,ingd}. Two crossings of the theoretical
functions occur before 2020, one in 1966, when Japan overtook UK, and
the other in 2000, when Germany overtook UK. The years of these
intersections are correctly borne out by the World Bank
data~\citep{jpgd,degd,ukgd}. The remaining three intersections
are to occur after 2020, and, hence, are predictive in nature. 
%As it happens, the GDP of India has indeed overtaken the GDP of UK in 2022. 
The first of these, in 2022, has already happened, when the GDP of 
India overtook the GDP of UK. 
Thereafter, the successive overtakes of the 
GDPs of Germany and Japan are predicted to occur in the years 2035
and 2047, respectively. In this plot, the relative positions of
Japan and Germany remain qualitatively unchanged throughout. However,
UK, which began ahead of the other three countries in 1960,
brings up the rear of the group from 2022 onwards. In contrast,
India, which started behind the others in 1960, is to
lead the group from 2047 onwards.
}}
\end{center}
\end{figure}
elements.2211.03125_820030c63fa1f892ccfd1442c5a1a: in the graph) it shows India to have the lowest GDP among the four national economies that we compare
elements.2211.03125_aa0320f4b73d44e99b79c01eb621f: The explanation for this lies in the history of the latter half of the twentieth century
elements.2211.03125_b40c94187434912d125112c75bddc: In the years following the Second World War, which ended in 1945, it became a policy imperative for USA (mainly due to the Cold War against the erstwhile Soviet Union) to aid and expedite the economic revival of both war-ravaged Japan and Western Europe (the latter under the Marshall Plan)
elements.2211.03125_f195a444de805b33b7f57e6ef02e9: Guided by USA thus, Japan, Germany (then West Germany) and UK had achieved political peace and economic prosperity by 1960
elements.2211.03125_4a714f7cc997ca794065c547f4f23: In contrast, during the same period, India, freed from colonial rule about a decade earlier, did not experience the advantages that regenerated the economies of Japan, Germany and UK
elements.2211.03125_e35ae5b446a2938b727d18e1a900b: Two factors, more than any other, impeded the GDP growth of India
elements.2211.03125_4ac77d25c35771d8ea3c36f8a8e82: The first is government policies in economic matters, and the second is a series of wars
elements.2211.03125_be36aef38a2502381fc10f0a6efb6: in which India was embroiled in the initial three decades of its sovereign existence
elements.2211.03125_ea17eff423717e1758bcfca8d09fb: Unsurprisingly then, the GDP growth of India is seen to trail those of the other countries in Fig.
elements.2211.03125_b76abab8b3f6807150ec44ae49e2c: And yet by 2047, the GDP of India is projected in Fig.
elements.2211.03125_0adfb16c8f11537a7d1326480a599: to lead the GDPs of the other three countries
elements.2211.03125_55cd13c4d0b5d565d3bd265862990: This will be possible only because India has maintained a steady GDP growth rate over an extended duration
elements.2211.03125_24d93abc5d33e57240ae919dfdf06: One reason for this sustained growth rate is that India is a country of sub-continental proportions with a large population, unlike Japan, Germany and UK
elements.2211.03125_cf6c9d9adb0372daa3892df35d308: Now, it is known that the GDP of a national economy is scaled as a function of its trade by a power law,
elements.2211.03125_f304b980b6d037a0760c93382c588: For all the countries that we study here, the power-law scaling is known to hold true over at least two orders of magnitude
elements.2211.03125_eeb1648722a613f420de16e7f4941: distinguishes the economies of large countries (with large areas and populations) from the economies of small ones (with small areas and populations)
elements.2211.03125_a11d52604040da8a0d1e32915dedd: In the former type, which includes India (as well as USA and China),
elements.2211.03125_86405b29e3076cd3d562600b9c3db: In the latter type, which includes Japan, Germany and UK,
elements.2211.03125_c357d9dd1a2b0092dbe6aba21eeaf: We now explain how the distinction between the two types of national economies can cause
elements.2211.03125_8f39839065c257020c47c1983c09a: a difference in trading patterns, with a concomitant effect on the GDP growth
elements.2211.03125_6bd34c09dde221506bb88752a94dd: A country with a large population has the advantage of a proportionately large domestic consumption of its own products, which in turn makes a proportionately greater contribution to the GDP, as compared to the contribution from trade
elements.2211.03125_6d3f63be4fc69d0cb34d23af7b63d: contribution of trade to the overall GDP growth reduces, a condition that is reflected by a lower value of
elements.2211.03125_0efb875a46b5c1d1db618df501ba2: The same feature is also known for USA and China, which like India, are geographically extended countries with large populations
elements.2211.03125_e018dd9fbfc04cfbc439a8e63717c: Countries with small populations, on the other hand, are bereft of the means of the high domestic consumption that attends a large population, and thus they have to rely more on trade with other countries to enhance their GDPs
elements.2211.03125_c67f77d6d72f9f6dd41447c4bb61d: This condition is reflected by a higher value of
elements.2211.03125_5fb1660382d55f6e5e106dbe05e08: , as is known to happen in the case of Japan, Germany and UK
elements.2211.03125_55c170877444069bc8bbe17918744: Now, the growth of trade also saturates according to the logistic function
elements.2211.03125_d79f6d7d9a2b74f5ebab590cb6ea1: , and since trade is highly correlated with GDP
elements.2211.03125_62fb4def714ec9d080b9008555cf2: , a saturation of trade implies a corresponding saturation of the GDP
elements.2211.03125_d150b2fa4f729a568160b33170e5e: Therefore, countries that depend more on external trade than on domestic consumption will see their GDP growth saturate when their trade saturates due to market-driven inhibitors
elements.2211.03125_f0e4298b73ab7cc2e1d7b394307c8: This is what we see for Japan, Germany and UK in Fig.
elements.2211.03125_bfe47feda4ebb619f5c59f8137c76: , whereas the GDP of India, despite its slow start, will outpace the GDP of the other three countries on the strength of its large volume of domestic consumption.
elements.2211.03125_97c3581b3fe1039ec9fda89577a31: The suitability of the logistic equation to model the dynamics of GDP and trade has been established already
elements.2211.03125_19f5c3dc9fd9fe2559d0e0345cb4b: In the present study we proceed further to show that the logistic equation is also effective in forecasting the outcome of GDP competitiveness among some leading national economies
elements.2211.03125_9df2c1676713c7a37fbbb08fc40ff: Our logistic forecasting method has been vindicated both retrospectively and for future times
elements.2211.03125_d3f0964cf052b29e5d84381483238: In the former case, it has correctly estimated the years when the GDPs of Japan and Germany overtook the GDP of UK (1966 and 2000, respectively)
elements.2211.03125_94a5213764ba4e29e04b315c96aff: In the latter case, looking forward in time, the logistic method has also been successful in forecasting 2022 as the year in which the GDP of India is to overtake the GDP of UK
elements.2211.03125_e39ecebfacda01fd0d52108e443fe: What now remains to be seen is the fulfillment of the forecast that the GDP of India will overtake the GDPs of Germany and Japan in 2035 and 2047, respectively
elements.2211.03125_4e2a79a92a03a3df0feb3db4e9ece: All that said, we have to remember that the subject of our present study is the dynamics of social systems (national economies)
elements.2211.03125_3102607a8519e4e41cb8f63eb82b3: Hence, it must depend on real socio-economic data
elements.2211.03125_b1faa9ce9a38eab7c84891e60368a: For instance, the logistic functions in Fig.
elements.2211.03125_2ce9938f2a193cbd54578aaab3f9f: , which are at the core of our forecasts, have all been calibrated with the GDP data of the World Bank till 2020
elements.2211.03125_7df586a398933eef32a53d42e49da: However, unforeseen natural, social and political events can compromise our forecasts by recalibrating the parameters of the logistic equation
elements.2211.03125_91d86e0bb06136345069653c7fbb5: To understand what such events may be like, we consider some contemporary examples
elements.2211.03125_33b7df305e39e4634246fe232ee1d: Even in the first quarter of 2020 no one anticipated that within two years the global economy was to receive three major shocks
elements.2211.03125_6ab3ffcc4205499358b09e00c8638: These are, first, Covid-19, which became a global pandemic by the middle of 2020 and whose aftereffects are felt even in late 2022
elements.2211.03125_7872697b0995cd890ddbfe57a9335: The second shock has been the war in Ukraine, which broke out in early 2022, even before the world economy could fully recover from the damage it had suffered due to the Covid-19 pandemic
elements.2211.03125_efc376be48d0b4d9b2e11e570f36e: The Ukraine war, by now protracted beyond all expectations, has disrupted global supply chains and energy markets, the severity of which is not yet fully understood
elements.2211.03125_671e28674792a0f84c9e669709a04: The third shock has been droughts in Europe and China, which will affect crucial sectors like power and agriculture
elements.2211.03125_d0399c5380696f01812befd1deaa1: Considering that Europe and China belong to two major economic regions of the world, the former in the North-Atlantic and the latter in the Indo-Pacific, adverse climatic events in these regions will have an adverse impact on production globally.
